div1.p: George W. Lunkin vs Capt W.T. Matthews } Application for writ of Habeas Corpus

To the Honorable E.P. Oliphant judge of the 1st judicial Dist W.T. Your petitoner George W Lunkin complains of the defendant Capt W.T. Matthews and 1st alleges that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by the defendant at or near Lewiston W.T.

2nd The pretense of the restraint is an enlistment in the of the U.S.A 1st Oregon behold your petitioner was enlisted at Oakland Douglas County Oregon on the 23rd day of Feburary 1862 and at that time your petitioner was but seventeen years and six months of age and said enlistment took place without the the consent of petitioners parents
3rd Your petitioner alleges that when enlisted he had the promise of thirty one dollars per month no point of which has been paid
Wherefore your petitioner prays a writ of Habeas corpus an may serve and that this honorable court may inquire into said complaint and may discharge petitioner from said eff illegal restraint
George W Lunkin first being duly sworn says the matters and things stated in the foregoing complaint are true of his own knowledge
The foregoing subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th day of July - A.D. 1862
Geog W Lunkin vs Cap W. S. Matthews

Aug. 14th 1862 Writ allowed by E.P. Oliphant
Filed August 14th 1862 B.N. Secton Clerk
